metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6820 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - high.
metadata.Description:
Under certain conditions, when handling a ReadableStream, a race condition can cause a use-after-free. We are aware of targeted attacks in the wild abusing this flaw. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.7.0, Firefox < 74.0.1, and Firefox ESR < 68.6.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6820` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 74.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 74.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 74.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine
